result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
NO RECORD MADE. Attorney Emily K. Gaertner in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Michael Robert Barth in court for Joshua D. Jones. Clerk. M.Burke. State in victim rights compliance. This matter is set over at the request of Attorney Barth.
Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.

NO RECORD MADE. Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Barth. Still working on resolution.
Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant, Joshua D. Jones, appeared with Attorney Michael Robert Barth.  Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: WSJ, MRR except as allowed in CHIPS case.  *Not To Discuss Case w/ Brittany B.

02:55 PM   Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State.   Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk JT  Minutes:   Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.   Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 08:45 am. $1500  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event). mi
